summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between an FBI forensic examiner and a federal prosecutor regarding the coordination and technical details of loading digital evidence (image and video files) from seized devices onto a drive for discovery in a case. The emails discuss CART evidence numbers, IB numbers, and device identification for items seized from New York and Virgin Islands searches, with a final discovery deadline of November 9, 2020.

persons.role: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: FBI forensic examiner coordinating the transfer and decoding of digital evidence from seized devices for discovery, providing technical details about evidence numbers and device identification.

persons.name: M, (USANYS)
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York managing discovery, requesting specific evidence numbers and device information to meet a November 9 deadline.

events.title: Final discovery deadline

events.title: Evidence decoding and coordination
events.description: FBI forensic examiner provides decoded evidence numbers for multiple devices and coordinates loading image and video files for discovery.

keyFacts: The document reveals active evidence processing and discovery coordination in October 2020 for a case involving devices seized from New York and Virgin Islands searches.
A final discovery deadline of November 9, 2020, was looming, creating time pressure for the prosecution team.
The FBI forensic examiner was decoding CART evidence numbers and IB numbers for numerous devices, including Macs, thumb drives, and external drives.
COVID-19 was cited as impacting efforts to rebuild/recover some drives, potentially hindering evidence recovery.
The email chain shows detailed inter-agency coordination (FBI, US Attorney's Office, NYPD) on technical evidence matters under a protective order.
